Promise of entitlements structure. The promise will be rejected if configure

methods.name: getCurrentOfferingForPlacement

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
Promise of optional offering. The promise will be rejected if configure
has not been called yet.

methods.docs:
Retrieves a current offering for a placement identifier, use this to access offerings defined by targeting
placements configured in the RevenueCat dashboard.

methods.name: syncAttributesAndOfferingsIfNeeded

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
Promise of entitlements structure. The promise will be rejected if configure
has not been called yet.

methods.docs:
Syncs subscriber attributes and then fetches the configured offerings for this user. This method is intended to
be called when using Targeting Rules with Custom Attributes. Any subscriber attributes should be set before
calling this method to ensure the returned offerings are applied with the latest subscriber attributes.

methods.name: getProducts

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
A promise containing an array of products. The promise will be rejected
if the products are not properly configured in RevenueCat or if there is another error retrieving them.
Rejections return an error code, and a userInfo object with more information. The promise will also be rejected
if configure has not been called yet.

methods.docs: Fetch the product info

methods.name: purchaseStoreProduct

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
A promise of an object containing
a customer info object and a product identifier. Rejections return an error code,
a boolean indicating if the user cancelled the purchase, and an object with more information. The promise will
also be rejected if configure has not been called yet.

methods.docs: Make a purchase

methods.name: purchaseDiscountedProduct

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
A promise of an object containing
a customer info object and a product identifier. Rejections return an error code,
a boolean indicating if the user cancelled the purchase, and an object with more information. The promise will be
rejected if configure has not been called yet.

methods.docs: iOS only. Purchase a product applying a given discount.

methods.name: purchasePackage

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
A promise of an object containing
a customer info object and a product identifier. Rejections return an error code, a boolean indicating if the
user cancelled the purchase, and an object with more information. The promise will be also be rejected if configure
has not been called yet.

methods.docs: Make a purchase

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
A promise of an object containing
a customer info object and a product identifier. Rejections return an error code, a boolean indicating if the
user cancelled the purchase, and an object with more information. The promise will be also be rejected if configure
has not been called yet.

methods.docs: Google only. Make a purchase of a subscriptionOption

methods.name: purchaseDiscountedPackage

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
A promise of an object containing
a customer info object and a product identifier. Rejections return an error code, a boolean indicating if the
user cancelled the purchase, and an object with more information. The promise will be also be rejected if configure
has not been called yet.

methods.docs: iOS only. Purchase a package applying a given discount.

methods.name: restorePurchases

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
A promise of a customer info object. Rejections return an error code, and an
userInfo object with more information. The promise will be also be rejected if configure has not been called yet.

methods.docs: Restores a user's previous purchases and links their appUserIDs to any user's also using those purchases.

methods.name: getAppUserID

tags.name: returns
tags.text: The app user id in a promise

methods.docs: Get the appUserID

methods.name: logIn

parameters.name: options
parameters.docs: The appUserID that should be linked to the current user

tags.name: param
tags.text: options The appUserID that should be linked to the current user

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
A promise of an object that contains the customerInfo after logging in, as well
as a boolean indicating whether the user has just been created for the first time in the RevenueCat backend. The
promise will be rejected if configure has not been called yet or if there's an issue logging in.

methods.docs:
This function will log in the current user with an appUserID. Typically, this would be used after a log in
to identify a user without calling configure.

methods.name: logOut

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
A promise of a customer info object. Rejections return an error code,
and a userInfo object with more information. The promise will be rejected if configure has not been called yet or if
there's an issue logging out.

methods.docs: Logs out the Purchases client clearing the saved appUserID. This will generate a random user id and save it in the cache.

methods.name: setLogLevel

parameters.name: options
parameters.docs: Log level to use to display logs.

tags.name: param
tags.text: options Log level to use to display logs.

methods.docs:
Used to set the log level. Useful for debugging issues with the lovely team @RevenueCat.
The default is {LOG_LEVEL.INFO} in release builds and {LOG_LEVEL.DEBUG} in debug builds.

methods.name: setLogHandler

parameters.name: logHandler
parameters.docs:
It will get called for each log event.
Use this function to redirect the log to your own logging system

tags.name: param
tags.text:
logHandler It will get called for each log event.
Use this function to redirect the log to your own logging system

methods.docs:
Set a custom log handler for redirecting logs to your own logging system.
By default, this sends info, warning, and error messages.
If you wish to receive Debug level messages, see [setLogLevel].

methods.name: getCustomerInfo

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
A promise of a customer info object. Rejections return an error code, and an
userInfo object with more information. The promise will be rejected if configure has not been called yet or if
there's an issue getting the customer information.

methods.docs: Gets current customer info

methods.name: syncPurchases

tags.name: warning
tags.text: This function should only be called if you're not calling purchaseProduct/purchaseStoreProduct/purchasePackage/purchaseSubscriptionOption.

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
The promise will be rejected if configure has not been called yet or if there's an error
syncing purchases.

methods.docs:
This method will send all the purchases to the RevenueCat backend. Call this when using your own implementation
for subscriptions anytime a sync is needed, like after a successful purchase.

methods.name: syncObserverModeAmazonPurchase

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
The promise will be rejected if configure has not been called yet or if there's an error
syncing purchases.

methods.docs:
This method will send a purchase to the RevenueCat backend. This function should only be called if you are
in Amazon observer mode or performing a client side migration of your current users to RevenueCat.

The receipt IDs are cached if successfully posted, so they are not posted more than once.

methods.name: enableAdServicesAttributionTokenCollection

tags.name: returns
tags.text: The promise will be rejected if configure has not been called yet.

methods.docs: Enable automatic collection of Apple Search Ad attribution on iOS. Disabled by default. Supported in iOS 14.3+ only

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
If the `appUserID` has been generated by RevenueCat or not.
The promise will be rejected if configure has not been called yet.

methods.name: checkTrialOrIntroductoryPriceEligibility

parameters.name: options
parameters.docs: Array of product identifiers for which you want to compute eligibility

tags.name: note
tags.text:
Subscription groups are automatically collected for determining eligibility. If RevenueCat can't
definitively compute the eligibility, most likely because of missing group information, it will return
`INTRO_ELIGIBILITY_STATUS_UNKNOWN`. The best course of action on unknown status is to display the non-intro
pricing, to not create a misleading situation. To avoid this, make sure you are testing with the latest version of
iOS so that the subscription group can be collected by the SDK. Android always returns INTRO_ELIGIBILITY_STATUS_UNKNOWN.

tags.name: param
tags.text: options Array of product identifiers for which you want to compute eligibility

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
: IntroEligibility> } A map of IntroEligility per productId. The promise
will be rejected if configure has not been called yet or if there's in an error checking eligibility.

methods.docs:
iOS only. Computes whether a user is eligible for the introductory pricing period of a given product.
You should use this method to determine whether you show the user the normal product price or the
introductory price. This also applies to trials (trials are considered a type of introductory pricing).

methods.name: getPromotionalOffer

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
Returns when the `PurchasesPaymentDiscount` is returned.
Null is returned for Android and incompatible iOS versions. The promise will be rejected if configure has not been
called yet or if there's an error getting the payment discount.

methods.docs: iOS only. Use this function to retrieve the `PurchasesPromotionalOffer` for a given `PurchasesPackage`.

methods.name: invalidateCustomerInfoCache

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
The promise will be rejected if configure has not been called yet or there's an error
invalidating the customer info cache.

methods.docs:
Invalidates the cache for customer information.

Most apps will not need to use this method; invalidating the cache can leave your app in an invalid state.
Refer to https://docs.revenuecat.com/docs/customer-info#section-get-user-information for more information on
using the cache properly.

This is useful for cases where customer information might have been updated outside the app, like if a
promotional subscription is granted through the RevenueCat dashboard.

methods.name: presentCodeRedemptionSheet

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
The promise will be rejected if configure has not been called yet or there's an error
presenting the code redemption sheet.

methods.docs:
iOS 14.0+ only. Presents a code redemption sheet, useful for redeeming offer codes
Refer to https://docs.revenuecat.com/docs/ios-subscription-offers#offer-codes for more information on how
to configure and use offer codes

methods.name: setAttributes

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.docs: Map of attributes by key. Set the value as an empty string to delete an attribute.

tags.name: param
tags.text: attributes Map of attributes by key. Set the value as an empty string to delete an attribute.

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
The promise will be rejected if configure has not been called yet or there's an error
setting the subscriber attributes.

methods.docs:
Subscriber attributes are useful for storing additional, structured information on a user.
Since attributes are writable using a public key they should not be used for
managing secure or sensitive information such as subscription status, coins, etc.

Key names starting with "$" are reserved names used by RevenueCat. For a full list of key
restrictions refer to our guide: https://docs.revenuecat.com/docs/subscriber-attributes

methods.name: canMakePayments
methods.signature: (options?: { features?: BILLING_FEATURE[] | undefined; } | undefined) => Promise<{ canMakePayments: boolean; }>

parameters.name: options
parameters.docs:
An array of feature types to check for support. Feature types must be one of
[BILLING_FEATURE]. By default, is an empty list and no specific feature support will be checked.

tags.name: param
tags.text:
options An array of feature types to check for support. Feature types must be one of
[BILLING_FEATURE]. By default, is an empty list and no specific feature support will be checked.

tags.name: returns
tags.text: promise with boolean response. True if billing is supported, false otherwise.

methods.docs:
Check if billing is supported for the current user (meaning IN-APP purchases are supported)
and optionally, whether a list of specified feature types are supported.

Note: Billing features are only relevant to Google Play Android users.
For other stores and platforms, billing features won't be checked.

methods.name: beginRefundRequestForActiveEntitlement

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
Returns refundRequestStatus: The status of the
refund request. Keep in mind the status could be REFUND_REQUEST_STATUS.USER_CANCELLED

methods.docs:
iOS 15+ only. Presents a refund request sheet in the current window scene for
the latest transaction associated with the active entitlement.

If the request was unsuccessful, no active entitlements could be found for
the user, or multiple active entitlements were found for the user,
the promise will return an error.
If called in an unsupported platform (Android or iOS < 15), an `UnsupportedPlatformException` will be thrown.

Important: This method should only be used if your user can only have a single active entitlement at a given time.
If a user could have more than one entitlement at a time, use `beginRefundRequestForEntitlement` instead.

methods.name: beginRefundRequestForEntitlement

parameters.name: options
parameters.docs: The entitlement to begin a refund request for.

tags.name: param
tags.text: options The entitlement to begin a refund request for.

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
Returns refundRequestStatus: The status of the
refund request. Keep in mind the status could be REFUND_REQUEST_STATUS.USER_CANCELLED

methods.docs:
iOS 15+ only. Presents a refund request sheet in the current window scene for
the latest transaction associated with the `entitlement`.

If the request was unsuccessful, the promise will return an error.
If called in an unsupported platform (Android or iOS < 15), an `UnsupportedPlatformException` will be thrown.

methods.name: beginRefundRequestForProduct

parameters.name: options
parameters.docs: The StoreProduct to begin a refund request for.

tags.name: param
tags.text: options The StoreProduct to begin a refund request for.

tags.name: returns
tags.text:
Returns a REFUND_REQUEST_STATUS: The status of the
refund request. Keep in mind the status could be REFUND_REQUEST_STATUS.USER_CANCELLED

methods.docs:
iOS 15+ only. Presents a refund request sheet in the current window scene for
the latest transaction associated with the `product`.

If the request was unsuccessful, the promise will return an error.
If called in an unsupported platform (Android or iOS < 15), an `UnsupportedPlatformException` will be thrown.

methods.name: showInAppMessages

parameters.name: options
parameters.docs:
An array of message types that the stores can display inside your app. Values must be one of
[IN_APP_MESSAGE_TYPE]. By default, is undefined and all message types will be shown.

tags.name: param
tags.text:
options An array of message types that the stores can display inside your app. Values must be one of
[IN_APP_MESSAGE_TYPE]. By default, is undefined and all message types will be shown.

tags.name: returns
tags.text: The promise will be rejected if configure has not been called yet.

methods.docs:
Shows in-app messages available from the App Store or Google Play. You need to disable messages from showing
automatically using [PurchasesConfiguration.shouldShowInAppMessagesAutomatically].

Note: In iOS, this requires version 16+. In older versions the promise will be resolved successfully
immediately.

methods.name: isConfigured

tags.name: returns
tags.text: promise with boolean response

methods.docs: Check if configure has finished and Purchases has been configured.

interfaces.name: PurchasesConfiguration
interfaces.docs: Holds parameters to initialize the SDK.

properties.name: apiKey
properties.docs: RevenueCat API Key. Needs to be a string

properties.name: appUserID
properties.docs: A unique id for identifying the user

properties.name: observerMode
properties.docs:
An optional boolean. Set this to TRUE if you have your own IAP implementation and
want to use only RevenueCat's backend. Default is FALSE. If you are on Android and setting this to ON, you will have
to acknowledge the purchases yourself.

properties.name: userDefaultsSuiteName
properties.docs:
An optional string. iOS-only, will be ignored for Android.
Set this if you would like the RevenueCat SDK to store its preferences in a different NSUserDefaults
suite, otherwise it will use standardUserDefaults. Default is null, which will make the SDK use standardUserDefaults.

properties.name: usesStoreKit2IfAvailable

tags.text:
RevenueCat currently uses StoreKit 1 for purchases, as its stability in production scenarios has
proven to be more performant than StoreKit 2.
We're collecting more data on the best approach, but StoreKit 1 vs StoreKit 2 is an implementation detail
that you shouldn't need to care about.
We recommend not using this parameter, letting RevenueCat decide for you which StoreKit implementation to use.
tags.name: deprecated

properties.docs:
iOS-only, will be ignored for Android.
Set this to TRUE to enable StoreKit2.
Default is FALSE.

properties.name: useAmazon
properties.docs: An optional boolean. Android only. Required to configure the plugin to be used in the Amazon Appstore.

properties.name: shouldShowInAppMessagesAutomatically
properties.docs:
Whether we should show store in-app messages automatically. Both Google Play and the App Store provide in-app
messages for some situations like billing issues. By default, those messages will be shown automatically.
This allows to disable that behavior, so you can display those messages at your convenience. For more information,
check: https://rev.cat/storekit-message and https://rev.cat/googleplayinappmessaging

properties.name: entitlementVerificationMode
properties.docs:
Verification strictness levels for [EntitlementInfo].
See https://rev.cat/trusted-entitlements for more info.

interfaces.name: CustomerInfo
interfaces.docs: Type containing all information regarding the customer

properties.name: entitlements
properties.docs: Entitlements attached to this customer info

properties.name: activeSubscriptions
properties.docs: Set of active subscription skus

properties.name: allPurchasedProductIdentifiers
properties.docs: Set of purchased skus, active and inactive

properties.name: latestExpirationDate
properties.docs: The latest expiration date of all purchased skus

properties.name: firstSeen
properties.docs: The date this user was first seen in RevenueCat.

properties.name: originalAppUserId
properties.docs: The original App User Id recorded for this user.

properties.name: requestDate
properties.docs: Date when this info was requested

properties.name: allExpirationDates
properties.docs: Map of skus to expiration dates

properties.name: allPurchaseDates
properties.docs: Map of skus to purchase dates

properties.name: originalApplicationVersion
properties.docs:
Returns the version number for the version of the application when the
user bought the app. Use this for grandfathering users when migrating
to subscriptions.

This corresponds to the value of CFBundleVersion (in iOS) in the
Info.plist file when the purchase was originally made. This is always null
in Android

properties.name: originalPurchaseDate
properties.docs:
Returns the purchase date for the version of the application when the user bought the app.
Use this for grandfathering users when migrating to subscriptions.

properties.name: managementURL
properties.docs:
URL to manage the active subscription of the user. If this user has an active iOS
subscription, this will point to the App Store, if the user has an active Play Store subscription
it will point there. If there are no active subscriptions it will be null.
If there are multiple for different platforms, it will point to the device store.

properties.name: nonSubscriptionTransactions
properties.docs:
List of all non subscription transactions. Use this to fetch the history of
non-subscription purchases

interfaces.name: PurchasesEntitlementInfos
interfaces.docs: Contains all the entitlements associated to the user.

properties.name: all
properties.docs: Map of all EntitlementInfo (`PurchasesEntitlementInfo`) objects (active and inactive) keyed by entitlement identifier.

properties.name: active
properties.docs: Map of active EntitlementInfo (`PurchasesEntitlementInfo`) objects keyed by entitlement identifier.

properties.name: verification
properties.docs: If entitlement verification was enabled, the result of that verification. If not, VerificationResult.NOT_REQUESTED

interfaces.name: PurchasesEntitlementInfo
interfaces.docs: The EntitlementInfo object gives you access to all of the information about the status of a user entitlement.

properties.name: identifier
properties.docs: The entitlement identifier configured in the RevenueCat dashboard

properties.name: isActive
properties.docs: True if the user has access to this entitlement

properties.name: willRenew
properties.docs: True if the underlying subscription is set to renew at the end of the billing period (expirationDate).

properties.name: periodType
properties.docs: The last period type this entitlement was in. Either: NORMAL, INTRO, TRIAL.

properties.name: latestPurchaseDate
properties.docs: The latest purchase or renewal date for the entitlement in ISO8601 format.

properties.name: latestPurchaseDateMillis
properties.docs: The latest purchase or renewal date for the entitlement in milliseconds.

properties.name: originalPurchaseDate
properties.docs: The first date this entitlement was purchased in ISO8601 format.

properties.name: originalPurchaseDateMillis
properties.docs: The first date this entitlement was purchased in milliseconds.

properties.name: expirationDate
properties.docs:
The expiration date for the entitlement in ISO8601, can be `null` for lifetime access.
If the `periodType` is `trial`, this is the trial expiration date.

properties.name: expirationDateMillis
properties.docs:
The expiration date for the entitlement in milliseconds, can be `null` for lifetime access.
If the `periodType` is `trial`, this is the trial expiration date.

properties.name: store
properties.docs: The store where this entitlement was unlocked from.

properties.name: productIdentifier
properties.docs: The product identifier that unlocked this entitlement

properties.name: productPlanIdentifier
properties.docs: The product plan identifier that unlocked this entitlement. Android subscriptions only, null on consumables and iOS.

properties.name: isSandbox
properties.docs: False if this entitlement is unlocked via a production purchase

properties.name: unsubscribeDetectedAt
properties.docs:
The date an unsubscribe was detected in ISO8601 format. Can be `null`.

Entitlement may still be active even if user has unsubscribed. Check the `isActive` property.

properties.name: unsubscribeDetectedAtMillis
properties.docs:
The date an unsubscribe was detected in milliseconds. Can be `null`.

Entitlement may still be active even if user has unsubscribed. Check the `isActive` property.

properties.name: billingIssueDetectedAt
properties.docs:
The date a billing issue was detected in ISO8601 format. Can be `null` if there is no billing issue or an
issue has been resolved

Entitlement may still be active even if there is a billing issue. Check the `isActive` property.

properties.name: billingIssueDetectedAtMillis
properties.docs:
The date a billing issue was detected in milliseconds. Can be `null` if there is no billing issue or an
issue has been resolved

Entitlement may still be active even if there is a billing issue. Check the `isActive` property.

properties.name: ownershipType
properties.docs:
Supported ownership types for an entitlement.
PURCHASED if the purchase was made directly by this user.
FAMILY_SHARED if the purchase has been shared to this user by a family member.
UNKNOWN if the purchase has no or an unknown ownership type.

properties.name: verification
properties.docs: If entitlement verification was enabled, the result of that verification. If not, VerificationResult.NOT_REQUESTED

interfaces.name: PurchasesStoreTransaction
interfaces.docs: Represents a non-subscription transaction in the Store.

properties.name: transactionIdentifier
properties.docs: Id of the transaction.

properties.name: productIdentifier
properties.docs: Product Id associated with the transaction.

properties.name: purchaseDate
properties.docs: Purchase date of the transaction in ISO 8601 format.

interfaces.name: PurchasesOfferings
interfaces.docs:
Contains all the offerings configured in RevenueCat dashboard.
For more info see https://docs.revenuecat.com/docs/entitlements

properties.name: all
properties.docs: Map of all Offerings [PurchasesOffering] objects keyed by their identifier.

properties.name: current
properties.docs: Current offering configured in the RevenueCat dashboard.

interfaces.name: PurchasesOffering
interfaces.docs:
An offering is a collection of Packages (`PurchasesPackage`) available for the user to purchase.
For more info see https://docs.revenuecat.com/docs/entitlements

properties.name: identifier
properties.docs: Unique identifier defined in RevenueCat dashboard.

properties.name: serverDescription
properties.docs: Offering description defined in RevenueCat dashboard.

properties.name: metadata
availablePackages
properties.docs: Array of `Package` objects available for purchase.

properties.name: lifetime
properties.docs: Lifetime package type configured in the RevenueCat dashboard, if available.

properties.name: annual
properties.docs: Annual package type configured in the RevenueCat dashboard, if available.

properties.name: sixMonth
properties.docs: Six month package type configured in the RevenueCat dashboard, if available.

properties.name: threeMonth
properties.docs: Three month package type configured in the RevenueCat dashboard, if available.

properties.name: twoMonth
properties.docs: Two month package type configured in the RevenueCat dashboard, if available.

properties.name: monthly
properties.docs: Monthly package type configured in the RevenueCat dashboard, if available.

properties.name: weekly
properties.docs: Weekly package type configured in the RevenueCat dashboard, if available.

interfaces.name: PurchasesPackage
interfaces.docs:
Contains information about the product available for the user to purchase.
For more info see https://docs.revenuecat.com/docs/entitlements

properties.name: identifier
properties.docs: Unique identifier for this package. Can be one a predefined package type or a custom one.

properties.name: packageType
properties.docs: Package type for the product. Will be one of [PACKAGE_TYPE].

properties.name: product
properties.docs: Product assigned to this package.

properties.name: offeringIdentifier

tags.text: Use presentedOfferingContext
tags.name: deprecated

properties.docs: Offering this package belongs to.

properties.name: presentedOfferingContext
properties.docs:
Offering context this package belongs to.
Null if not using offerings or if fetched directly from store via getProducts.

interfaces.name: PurchasesStoreProduct
interfaces.docs: Type representing a product from the Store.

properties.name: identifier
properties.docs: Product Id.

properties.name: description
properties.docs: Description of the product.

properties.name: title
properties.docs: Title of the product.

properties.name: price
properties.docs:
Price of the product in the local currency.
Contains the price value of defaultOption for Google Play.

properties.name: priceString
properties.docs:
Formatted price of the item, including its currency sign.
Contains the formatted price value of defaultOption for Google Play.

properties.name: currencyCode
properties.docs:
Currency code for price and original price.
Contains the currency code value of defaultOption for Google Play.

properties.name: introPrice
properties.docs: Introductory price.

properties.name: discounts
properties.docs: Collection of discount offers for a product. Null for Android.

properties.name: productCategory
properties.docs: Product category.

properties.name: productType
properties.docs:
The specific type of subscription or one time purchase this product represents.
Important: In iOS, if using StoreKit 1, we cannot determine the type.

properties.name: subscriptionPeriod
properties.docs:
Subscription period, specified in ISO 8601 format. For example,
P1W equates to one week, P1M equates to one month,
P3M equates to three months, P6M equates to six months,
and P1Y equates to one year.
Note: Not available for Amazon.

properties.name: defaultOption
properties.docs: Default subscription option for a product. Google Play only.

properties.name: subscriptionOptions
properties.docs: Collection of subscription options for a product. Google Play only.

properties.name: presentedOfferingIdentifier

tags.text: Use presentedOfferingContext
tags.name: deprecated

properties.docs:
Offering identifier the store product was presented from.
Null if not using offerings or if fetched directly from store via getProducts.

properties.name: presentedOfferingContext
properties.docs:
Offering context this package belongs to.
Null if not using offerings or if fetched directly from store via getProducts.

interfaces.name: PurchasesIntroPrice
interfaces.docs: Contains information about the introductory price for a product

properties.name: price
properties.docs: Price in the local currency.

properties.name: priceString
properties.docs: Formatted price, including its currency sign, such as 3.99.

properties.name: cycles
properties.docs: Number of subscription billing periods for which the user will be given the discount, such as 3.

properties.name: period
properties.docs: Billing period of the discount, specified in ISO 8601 format.

properties.name: periodUnit
properties.docs: Unit for the billing period of the discount, can be DAY, WEEK, MONTH or YEAR.

properties.name: periodNumberOfUnits
properties.docs: Number of units for the billing period of the discount.

interfaces.name: PurchasesStoreProductDiscount
interfaces.docs: Contains information about a discount offer for a product

properties.name: identifier
properties.docs: Identifier of the discount.

properties.name: price
properties.docs: Price in the local currency.

properties.name: priceString
properties.docs: Formatted price, including its currency sign, such as 3.99.

properties.name: cycles
properties.docs: Number of subscription billing periods for which the user will be given the discount, such as 3.

properties.name: period
properties.docs: Billing period of the discount, specified in ISO 8601 format.

properties.name: periodUnit
properties.docs: Unit for the billing period of the discount, can be DAY, WEEK, MONTH or YEAR.

properties.name: periodNumberOfUnits
properties.docs: Number of units for the billing period of the discount.

interfaces.name: SubscriptionOption
interfaces.docs:
Contains all details associated with a SubscriptionOption
Used only for Google

properties.name: id
properties.docs:
Identifier of the subscription option
If this SubscriptionOption represents a base plan, this will be the basePlanId.
If it represents an offer, it will be basePlanId:offerId

properties.name: storeProductId
properties.docs:
Identifier of the StoreProduct associated with this SubscriptionOption
This will be subId:basePlanId

properties.name: productId
properties.docs:
Identifer of the subscription associated with this SubscriptionOption
This will be subId

properties.name: pricingPhases
properties.docs: Pricing phases defining a user's payment plan for the product over time.

properties.name: tags
properties.docs: Tags defined on the base plan or offer. Empty for Amazon.

properties.name: isBasePlan
properties.docs: True if this SubscriptionOption represents a subscription base plan (rather than an offer).

properties.name: billingPeriod
properties.docs: The subscription period of fullPricePhase (after free and intro trials).

properties.name: isPrepaid
properties.docs: True if the subscription is pre-paid.

properties.name: fullPricePhase
properties.docs:
The full price PricingPhase of the subscription.
Looks for the last price phase of the SubscriptionOption.

properties.name: freePhase
properties.docs:
The free trial PricingPhase of the subscription.
Looks for the first pricing phase of the SubscriptionOption where amountMicros is 0.
There can be a freeTrialPhase and an introductoryPhase in the same SubscriptionOption.

properties.name: introPhase
properties.docs:
The intro trial PricingPhase of the subscription.
Looks for the first pricing phase of the SubscriptionOption where amountMicros is greater than 0.
There can be a freeTrialPhase and an introductoryPhase in the same SubscriptionOption.

properties.name: presentedOfferingIdentifier

tags.text: Use presentedOfferingContext
tags.name: deprecated

properties.docs: Offering identifier the subscription option was presented from

properties.name: presentedOfferingContext
properties.docs:
Offering context this package belongs to.
Null if not using offerings or if fetched directly from store via getProducts.

interfaces.name: PricingPhase
interfaces.docs: Contains all the details associated with a PricingPhase

properties.name: billingPeriod
properties.docs: Billing period for which the PricingPhase applies

properties.name: recurrenceMode
properties.docs: Recurrence mode of the PricingPhase

properties.name: billingCycleCount
properties.docs:
Number of cycles for which the pricing phase applies.
Null for infiniteRecurring or finiteRecurring recurrence modes.

properties.name: price
properties.docs: Price of the PricingPhase

properties.name: offerPaymentMode
properties.docs: Indicates how the pricing phase is charged for finiteRecurring pricing phases

interfaces.name: Period
interfaces.docs: Contains all the details associated with a Period

properties.name: unit
properties.docs: The number of period units: day, week, month, year, unknown

properties.name: value
properties.docs: The increment of time that a subscription period is specified in

properties.name: iso8601
properties.docs:
Specified in ISO 8601 format. For example, P1W equates to one week,
P1M equates to one month, P3M equates to three months, P6M equates to six months,
and P1Y equates to one year

interfaces.name: Price
interfaces.docs: Contains all the details associated with a Price

properties.name: formatted
properties.docs: Formatted price of the item, including its currency sign. For example $3.00

properties.name: amountMicros
properties.docs:
Price in micro-units, where 1,000,000 micro-units equal one unit of the currency.

For example, if price is "7.99", price_amount_micros is 7,990,000. This value represents
the localized, rounded price for a particular currency.

properties.name: currencyCode
properties.docs:
Returns ISO 4217 currency code for price and original price.

For example, if price is specified in British pounds sterling, price_currency_code is "GBP".
If currency code cannot be determined, currency symbol is returned.

interfaces.name: PresentedOfferingContext
interfaces.docs: Contains data about the context in which an offering was presented.

properties.name: offeringIdentifier
properties.docs: The identifier of the offering used to obtain this object.

properties.name: placementIdentifier
properties.docs: The identifier of the placement used to obtain this object.

properties.name: targetingContext
properties.docs: The revision of the targeting used to obtain this object.

interfaces.name: PresentedOfferingTargetingContext
interfaces.docs: Contains data about the context in which an offering was presented.

properties.name: revision
properties.docs: The revision of the targeting used to obtain this object.

properties.name: ruleId
properties.docs: The rule id from the targeting used to obtain this object.

properties.name: productIdentifiers
properties.docs: Array of product identifiers to obtain

properties.name: type
properties.docs: Optional type of products to fetch, can be SUBSCRIPTION or NON_SUBSCRIPTION. SUBSCRIPTION by default. Ignored in iOS.

properties.name: product
properties.docs: The product you want to purchase

properties.name: googleProductChangeInfo
properties.docs:
Android only. Optional GoogleProductChangeInfo you
wish to upgrade from containing the oldProductIdentifier and the optional prorationMode.

properties.name: googleIsPersonalizedPrice
properties.docs:
Android and Google only. Optional boolean indicates personalized pricing on products available for purchase in the EU.
For compliance with EU regulations. User will see "This price has been customized for you" in the purchase dialog when true.
See https://developer.android.com/google/play/billing/integrate#personalized-price for more info.

interfaces.name: GoogleProductChangeInfo
interfaces.docs: Holds the information used when upgrading from another sku. For Android use only.

properties.name: oldProductIdentifier
properties.docs: The old product identifier to upgrade from.

properties.name: prorationMode
properties.docs: The [PRORATION_MODE] to use when upgrading the given oldSKU.

properties.name: product
properties.docs: The product you want to purchase

properties.name: discount
properties.docs: Discount to apply to this package. Retrieve this discount using getPromotionalOffer.

interfaces.name: PurchasesPromotionalOffer
interfaces.docs: Holds the information about a PromotionalOffer in Apple's App Store.

properties.name: aPackage
properties.docs: The Package you wish to purchase. You can get the Packages by calling getOfferings

properties.name: googleProductChangeInfo
properties.docs:
Android only. Optional GoogleProductChangeInfo you
wish to upgrade from containing the oldProductIdentifier and the optional prorationMode.

properties.name: googleIsPersonalizedPrice
properties.docs:
Android and Google only. Optional boolean indicates personalized pricing on products available for purchase in the EU.
For compliance with EU regulations. User will see "This price has been customized for you" in the purchase dialog when true.
See https://developer.android.com/google/play/billing/integrate#personalized-price for more info.

properties.name: subscriptionOption
properties.docs: The SubscriptionOption you wish to purchase. You can get the SubscriptionOption from StoreProducts by calling getOfferings

properties.name: googleProductChangeInfo
properties.docs:
Android only. Optional GoogleProductChangeInfo you
wish to upgrade from containing the oldProductIdentifier and the optional prorationMode.

properties.name: googleIsPersonalizedPrice
properties.docs:
Android and Google only. Optional boolean indicates personalized pricing on products available for purchase in the EU.
For compliance with EU regulations. User will see "This price has been customized for you" in the purchase dialog when true.
See https://developer.android.com/google/play/billing/integrate#personalized-price for more info.

properties.name: aPackage
properties.docs: The Package you wish to purchase. You can get the Packages by calling getOfferings

properties.name: discount
properties.docs: Discount to apply to this package. Retrieve this discount using getPromotionalOffer.

interfaces.name: LogInResult
interfaces.docs: Holds the logIn result

properties.name: customerInfo
properties.docs: The Customer Info for the user.

properties.name: created
properties.docs: True if the call resulted in a new user getting created in the RevenueCat backend.

properties.name: productID
properties.docs: Product ID associated to the purchase.

properties.name: receiptID
properties.docs: ReceiptId that represents the Amazon purchase.

properties.name: amazonUserID
properties.docs: Amazon's userID. This parameter will be ignored when syncing a Google purchase.

properties.name: isoCurrencyCode
properties.docs: Product's currency code in ISO 4217 format.

properties.name: price
properties.docs: Product's price.

interfaces.name: IntroEligibility
interfaces.docs: Holds the introductory price status

properties.name: status
properties.docs: The introductory price eligibility status

properties.name: description
properties.docs: Description of the status

properties.name: product
properties.docs: The `PurchasesStoreProduct` the user intends to purchase.

properties.name: discount
properties.docs: The `PurchasesStoreProductDiscount` to apply to the product.

members.name: DISABLED
members.docs: The SDK will not perform any entitlement verification.

members.name: INFORMATIONAL
members.docs:
Enable entitlement verification.

If verification fails, this will be indicated with [VerificationResult.FAILED] in
the [EntitlementInfos.verification] and [EntitlementInfo.verification] properties but parsing will not fail
(i.e. Entitlements will still be granted).

This can be useful if you want to handle verification failures to display an error/warning to the user
or to track this situation but still grant access.

members.name: NOT_REQUESTED
members.docs:
No verification was done.

This value is returned when verification is not enabled in PurchasesConfiguration

members.name: VERIFIED
members.docs: Verification with our server was performed successfully.

members.name: FAILED
members.docs: Verification failed, possibly due to a MiTM attack.

members.name: VERIFIED_ON_DEVICE
members.docs: Verification was performed on device.

members.name: UNKNOWN
members.docs: A package that was defined with a custom identifier.

members.name: CUSTOM
members.docs: A package that was defined with a custom identifier.

members.name: LIFETIME
members.docs: A package configured with the predefined lifetime identifier.

members.name: ANNUAL
members.docs: A package configured with the predefined annual identifier.

members.name: SIX_MONTH
members.docs: A package configured with the predefined six month identifier.

members.name: THREE_MONTH
members.docs: A package configured with the predefined three month identifier.

members.name: TWO_MONTH
members.docs: A package configured with the predefined two month identifier.

members.name: MONTHLY
members.docs: A package configured with the predefined monthly identifier.

members.name: WEEKLY
members.docs: A package configured with the predefined weekly identifier.

members.name: NON_SUBSCRIPTION
members.docs: A type of product for non-subscription.

members.name: SUBSCRIPTION
members.docs: A type of product for subscriptions.

members.name: UNKNOWN
members.docs: A type of product for unknowns.

members.name: CONSUMABLE
members.docs: A consumable in-app purchase.

members.name: NON_CONSUMABLE
members.docs: A non-consumable in-app purchase. Only applies to Apple Store products.

members.name: NON_RENEWABLE_SUBSCRIPTION
members.docs: A non-renewing subscription. Only applies to Apple Store products.

members.name: AUTO_RENEWABLE_SUBSCRIPTION
members.docs: An auto-renewable subscription.

members.name: PREPAID_SUBSCRIPTION
members.docs: A subscription that is pre-paid. Only applies to Google Play products.

members.name: UNKNOWN
members.docs: Unable to determine product type.

members.name: INFINITE_RECURRING
members.docs: Pricing phase repeats infinitely until cancellation

members.name: FINITE_RECURRING
members.docs: Pricing phase repeats for a fixed number of billing periods

members.name: NON_RECURRING
members.docs: Pricing phase does not repeat

members.name: FREE_TRIAL
members.docs: Subscribers don't pay until the specified period ends

members.name: SINGLE_PAYMENT
members.docs: Subscribers pay up front for a specified period

members.name: DISCOUNTED_RECURRING_PAYMENT
members.docs: Subscribers pay a discounted amount for a specified number of periods

members.name: IMMEDIATE_WITH_TIME_PRORATION
members.docs:
Replacement takes effect immediately, and the remaining time will be
prorated and credited to the user. This is the current default behavior.

members.name: IMMEDIATE_AND_CHARGE_PRORATED_PRICE
members.docs:
Replacement takes effect immediately, and the billing cycle remains the
same. The price for the remaining period will be charged. This option is
only available for subscription upgrade.

members.name: IMMEDIATE_WITHOUT_PRORATION
members.docs:
Replacement takes effect immediately, and the new price will be charged on
next recurrence time. The billing cycle stays the same.

members.name: IMMEDIATE_AND_CHARGE_FULL_PRICE
members.docs:
Replacement takes effect immediately, and the user is charged full price
of new plan and is given a full billing cycle of subscription,
plus remaining prorated time from the old plan.

members.name: INTRO_ELIGIBILITY_STATUS_UNKNOWN
members.docs: RevenueCat doesn't have enough information to determine eligibility.

members.name: INTRO_ELIGIBILITY_STATUS_INELIGIBLE
members.docs: The user is not eligible for a free trial or intro pricing for this product.

members.name: INTRO_ELIGIBILITY_STATUS_ELIGIBLE
members.docs: The user is eligible for a free trial or intro pricing for this product.

members.name: INTRO_ELIGIBILITY_STATUS_NO_INTRO_OFFER_EXISTS
members.docs: There is no free trial or intro pricing for this product.

members.name: SUBSCRIPTIONS
members.docs: Purchase/query for subscriptions.

members.name: SUBSCRIPTIONS_UPDATE
members.docs: Subscriptions update/replace.

members.name: IN_APP_ITEMS_ON_VR
members.docs: Purchase/query for in-app items on VR.

members.name: SUBSCRIPTIONS_ON_VR
members.docs: Purchase/query for subscriptions on VR.

members.name: PRICE_CHANGE_CONFIRMATION
members.docs: Launch a price change confirmation flow.

members.name: SUCCESS
members.docs: Apple has received the refund request.

members.name: USER_CANCELLED
members.docs: User canceled submission of the refund request.

members.name: ERROR
members.docs: There was an error with the request. See message for more details.

members.name: BILLING_ISSUE
members.docs: In-app messages to indicate there has been a billing issue charging the user.

members.name: PRICE_INCREASE_CONSENT
members.docs:
iOS-only. This message will show if you increase the price of a subscription and
the user needs to opt-in to the increase.

members.name: GENERIC
members.docs: iOS-only. StoreKit generic messages.

typeAliases.name: CustomerInfoUpdateListener
typeAliases.docs: Listener used on updated customer info

typeAliases.name: LogHandler
typeAliases.docs: Listener used to receive log messages from the SDK.
